Obviously we're a big part of
that with the Convention Center.

1487.text:
You've got Mud Island that is
probably an under-utilized asset

1493.text:
So, there's a lot
of moving parts.

1495.text:
And unfortunately there's some
things that will take some time.

1500.text:
The city is looking at the
tourism development zone.

1501.text:
They're talking to the
state about some things.

1503.text:
- There are a bunch of players
who want to pick into this pool

1506.text:
of incentive money of
whatever part of it.

1510.text:
And there are just too many
people trying to get in on that.

1511.text:
- I don't even really
think that's the problem.

1513.text:
I think right now the city
is trying to figure out what

1516.text:
opportunities they have for
what types of incentives,

1523.text:
What will they be able to bring
to the table primarily through

1525.text:
surplus tourism development zone
revenues and the future of the

1529.text:
tourism development
zone in that area.

1532.text:
So, I think the city is working
with state officials and looking

1537.text:
at a lot of different things
to figure out what they can do.

1539.text:
And unfortunately that's a
process you can't snap your

1541.text:
fingers and get all the
answers that you need instantly.

1544.text:
And I think the administration
is moving as quickly as they can

1548.text: to try to sort that out.

1549.text:
And the important
thing is, you know,

1554.text:
So, however long it takes to
make sure that you're positioned

1557.text:
right for the future, I think
you need to do due diligence.

1559.text:
- We could have talked about
that for another 20 minutes but

1564.text: Thank you all for joining us.
